text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Friday:
- Landis & Gyr Communications in Zug will cut 15 of its 172 jobs and try to reduce the working hours of 50 employees.
- Seven federal departments in Switzerland will restructure at the start of 1998.
- Swiss copyright associations opened a "Swiss multimedia Copyright Clearing" center.
- Peter Kruger, a former Swiss real estate dealer, was taken into custody on the Cayman Islands on Thursday as Switzerland continues to seek his extradition.
- U.S. magazine "Time" in its next issue writes extensively about Switzerland's role in World War Two, depicting the Swiss as cold-blooded business people.
- Temporary employment group Adecco posted a revenue of 8.5 billion Swiss francs in 1996, a nine percent increase over 1995.
- Pfister Arco Holding, a subsidiary of Moebel Pfister AG, suffered a four percent decline to 506 million Swiss francs in 1996 consolidated sales.
- Rentenanstalt/Swiss Life overcame another hurdle in its efforts to become a joint stock company.
